### 1. Template Dumbbell-Chart

```{r 01, include = TRUE, results = FALSE, eval = TRUE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}

## Erstellen Datenframes
# Einzelne Ergebnisse f√ºr Parteien Eingeben (Mittelwerte)
CVP <- c(party_short = "CVP", mann = 18, frau = 22)
SP <- c(party_short = "SP", mann = 7, frau = 16)
FDP <- c(party_short = "FDP", mann = 8, frau = 12)
SVP <- c(party_short = "SVP", mann = 13.9, frau = 12)
GLP <- c(party_short = "GLP", mann = 17.6, frau = 19.1)
GPS <- c(party_short = "GPS", mann = 23, frau = 27)
# binden zu Datenframe
df_party_priv <- data.frame(rbind(CVP, SP, FDP, SVP, GLP, GPS))


## Plot erstellen, Plot Zeigen, Plot Speichern
# Plot erstellen
plot_party_priv <- df_party_priv %>%
  
             ggplot(. , aes(x = mann, xend = frau, y = party_short)) +
  
             geom_dumbbell(colour = "#dddddd", size = 3,
                           colour_x = "steelblue3", colour_xend = "indianred2") +

            labs(x = "Anteil [%]", y = NULL) +
  
            theme(axis.text.y = element_text(size=12),
                  axis.text.x = element_text(size=12)) +

            theme_bw() 

# Plot zeigen
plot_party_priv

# Plot abspeichern
ggsave(plot_party_priv, file = "./GrafikenTabellen/plot_party_priv.png",
       dpi = "retina", width = 15, height = 11, units = "cm")


```
